newsitem.title: FRANCE: France has no plan to shed Elf stake soon.
newsitem.headline: France has no plan to shed Elf stake soon.

text.p: The French government is not planning a sale of its 9.8 percent stake in energy group Elf Aquitaine in the near future, a finance ministry source said on Wednesday.
"We have 9.82 percent of Elf, and for the moment we're not selling it. This sale is not on the agenda," the source said.
Rumours of a possible sale, priced at around 385 francs per share, swept through the Paris bourse on Tuesday and boosted turnover in Elf to 1.8 million shares.
The stock was down 1.5 francs at 391.50 at 1145 GMT in volume of 413,000 shares. Traders said rumours of a state sale tend to emerge whenever the share approaches 400 francs.
"The government has always said 400 francs was a reasonable level at which to re-examine its participation," a trader said.
Some traders said they believed the government might still be considering an exit from Elf given the current context of high oil prices, a strong dollar and firm oil stocks.
